newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine economic zone investments up 25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippine economic zone investments up 25 pct.

text.p: Investments in Philippine economic zones totalled 65.306 billion pesos in 1996, up 25.5 percent from 52 billion pesos in the previous year, the Philippine Economic Zone Authority said on Tuesday.

Zone developers provided the bulk, putting in 42.6 billion pesos worth of investments during the period. Export-oriented manufacturing companies followed with total investments reaching 20.4 billion pesos.
Filipinos topped the list of investors, with investments amounting to 44.721 billion pesos. They were followed by the Japanese, 12.297 billion pesos, and Koreans with 2.448 billion pesos.
Investors inside the economic zones are eligible for tax and tariff incentives.
